newsitem.title: USA: Citation ends plans for secondary offer.
newsitem.headline: Citation ends plans for secondary offer.

text.p: Citation Computer Systems Inc said Tuesday it is terminating a proposed secondary common stock offering.
"We are disappointed that the secondary offering was not completed, but we feel we need to resolve the uncertainty in the marketplace," J. Robert Copper, chairman, said in a statement.

"We continue to believe that Citation has an effective strategy to become the information systems leader in healthcare," Copper added. "We will now concentrate all our efforts to implement that strategy."

The company said it filed a registration statement on July 16 with the Securities and Exchange Commission for the offering, which was to be managed by Volpe, Welty & Co, Jefferies and Co, and Punk, Ziegel & Knoell.
Citation said on October 1 that it was reviewing market conditions and would determine whether and when it would go forward with the offering.
